name: Philadelphia Marriott Downtown

reviews.text: It is a nice Marriott, the location is great for business and can do alota site seeing by foot. Good restaurants near-by. Easy to get a cab from the hotel. There is a full service Starbucks in the hotel that is ideal to grab something and go. it is downtown so there are a good number of homeless about so need to be careful.
reviews.title: Good Location for business and site seeing

reviews.text: The location of this hotel could not be better, right smack in the middle of Philadelphia (one block from City Hall). Reading Market is just across the street and Old Town is a short walk/subway ride away. The location also makes it easy to get to sports complexes in South Philly.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The conference facilities at this hotel are also very good. The place is clean, the staff is attentive and the surrounding are pleasing.
reviews.title: For the price paid...

reviews.text: Got a very good rate on this hotel and overall had a good stay. The hotel is very large and impersonal, but functions very well. We loved the pool and fitness centers, as well as the view from our room. The hotel is clean and pleasant, the staff are kind and helpful, everything is fine. The problem is that the hotel caters to the multitudes and not to the individual. For example, we have never stayed in a supposed four star hotel that does not offer complimentary newspapers (at least in the lobby!) and charges for small personal items, like combs (we paid $1.50 in the gift shop for a cheap comb!). Service also takes forever, we ordered an extra blanket and it took close to an hour to arrive. Overall not a bad choice, we just would have appreciated the amenities that we have come to expect from four star hotels.
reviews.title: Caring

reviews.text: To begin, I must fairly say that after being cheated out of several hundred dollars by Marriott, I avoid them whenever possible. This past weekend I could not, and so stayed at the downtown Marriott. The vast majority of the patrons were there to attend Army-Navy, played under horrible conditions. After the game the hotel personnel met guests at the door with blankets, hot chocolate, and could not have been more accommodating. If their corporate management shared their employees' attitude, I might actually stay at a Marriott again by choice.
reviews.title: Pay for the location and facilties

reviews.text: Wow! I visited the Reading Terminal a couple years ago and was happy to find this Marriott is right next door. Happy Girl! The room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Room was quiet. We were on the 18th floor. Quick check in. Friendly hosts answered our questions for area inquiries. This hotel is located right across the street from East Market train/subway station, so it's convenient from the airport or to other locations around town. Connected to the convention center. Lots of restaurants and shopping all around. I will stay here again when I come back to the area. Not one complaint.
reviews.title: Location Perfect

reviews.text: The downtown Marriott is centrally located to many of the attractions in Philadelphia. When one is there for a conference, the location allows you to pop out for a break and take a breather doing something fun. At the holiday time, this includes Macy*s (in the old Wanamaker building) with its annual light show. Once you get past the lobby, the hotel itself is getting a bit worn looking. The conference rooms themselves need some refurbishing. The room was fine, but located at the back of the hotel near the heating system made it noisy as the system clunked on and off during the night. Staff is excellent and even though the food was arranged by the conference attended, it was perfectly fine.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Daniel at the desk greeted me, and provided a fabulous, quick and easy checkin, even checking to make sure the rate I was booked at was the best available.
reviews.title: All-stars.
Good for work or events
reviews.text: The lounge attendants at the bar (13, I believe) were friendly and patient as my friends and I made up our minds.
My request for a top floor was met, and the overall cleanliness, room and amenities were outstanding.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This is a super hotel with all that the traveller and business person require. Rooms are lovely with tasteful decor and top level of cleanliness. Located in the perfect. Place for sightseeing and vast array of business facilities. Highly recommended to have meals here although close to many good resteraunts and bars. Would stay again when next in Philadelphia .
reviews.title: Conference and New England

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great stay, very welcoming front desk service and upscale hotel located right near City Hall in Philadelphia. Recently stayed here on a Saturday night in the city. The room rate was great for a weekend in the city. Hotel was very accommodating to Marriott Rewards members as they met all my requests at check in, and even a later checkout. My room was located on the 22nd floor with a great view of downtown and City Hall. Room was very fresh, large plush bedding and nicer amenities in the bathroom with a large amount of space as well. Only complaint I'd have is that my tv would not work, even after reporting down to the Front Desk I don't think this issue was ever resolved. Would definitely make another stay here though while visiting Philadelphia.
reviews.title: Welcoming downtown Philly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in many marriot's throughout the us and this was just an ok place for me. I called up and made reservations specifically asking not to be staring at a wall the whole time and wanted a place with somewhat of a view. We were on the 12th floor and got to look out at the other side of the building. Not a huge deal just would have been nice to see the pretty city versus a building. The beds were very uncomfortable and both my boyfriend and myself got hardly any sleep. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and williing to do anything for you it seems. I do have one gripe though and that is when I booked my room the woman insisted that I pay the rate of $210 with all the taxes since the valet was $46 a night if I had booked the room without it. This was an out right like valet is $40 for over night. This higher price room included breakfast which I really didn't need however I thought I was getting a better deal so I went with the higher priced room. Breakfast in the morning was buffett style and it was less than appealing. The eggs were like soup, and the food that was supposed to be hot was not. The bar is great and the bar tender knew how to make me a watermelon martini without it being on the menu or having to look it up, thats a real bar tender for you. Valet was great about getting us checked in and checked out. Overall just an ok stay I guess I just thought the room would be a little nicer for the high price I had paid nothing special can't say I would be back.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.text: In five years of attending the Mid Atlantic Irish Dance competition at this property, I have always been underwhelmed by the indifferent staff, less-than-pristine facilities, and unremarkable food. This morning I watched a bellman plow through a group of small children with a heavily-loaded luggage cart that he clearly could not see around. Tonight I gained some valuable insight into their management style. Inside the kitchen door of their `13` Restaurant (clearly visible to guests) is posted their service goal of 78.2%. Wow! Nothing like striving to be...mediocre! Congratulations folks....I'm delighted to say you have reached your goal. Way to go!
reviews.title: Shoot for the moon? Or maybe the toilet seat...

reviews.text: I made the reservation on September 16, 2013. Every time I make a reservation I always ask for extra towels, high floor, away from elevator and a refrigerator. I had called several days before check in and asked for early check in and verified my other requests, I was assured everything would be as requested.
reviews.title: Absolutely Not Acceptable of a Marriott

reviews.text: Stayed here Agusut 26-28 for a seminar. Hotel is very nice. Room was very nice. Bed was was one of the most comfortable I had ever slept in.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Staff is very friendly and even gave us recommendations for Cheese Steaks
reviews.title: A Great Location for Sightseeing; Spacious rooms

likes.liked: — spacious rooms, friendly staff, closeness to historic sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great deal on Priceline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend at the Downtown Marriott and was very pleased. It is a very large hotel with a good location. We were able to walk to all of the historic sights (the Liberty Belle, Constitution Mueseum, Independence Hall) and Chinatown. We were upgraded to the deluxe tower. It was a little bit of a walk to the room, but it was worth it. It was a spacious room with high ceillings and a pull-out couch along with 2 double beds. We found the staff very friendly from the front desk to the bellmen to the waitstaff in the restaurant. We requested a roll-away bed and it came very quickly. The hotel is also connected to the Hard Rock Cafe which is nice for a quick bite. Regarding it's location, the hotel isn't in the best part of Philly and there were numerous panhandlers on the streets near the hotel. The rates were reasonable for a city and I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Got this room for $70 on Priceline...My husband and I just got back from a cruise with the kids and needed a getaway just for ourselves.
reviews.title: A very nice play to stay, would recommend!

reviews.text: Location is Great. Beautiful. Rooms are slightly on the smaller side. Comfy beds, bathrooms are nice (great water pressure). Lots of historic stuff around. The hotel staff was cool and the banquets staff was very helpful (we had a work meeting thing). GREAT Gym. Lap pool. No sauna tho...
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: December 6-8 I stayed. Let me start off by saying that booking your trip via third party is not the way to go. Priceline is GARBAGE, but this is not the venue for this. Arrived at the hotel and I was a little nervous based on the mixed reviews I have read on line so this scared me. I tried to request options for the room before we arrived but that could not happen for I booked it though PRICELINE. The front desk person accommodated my request which I ask for corner room, 2 beds, and most important, I wanted to be in the renovated side of the hotel. All my request was giving stayed in 2370 top floor with great view.
reviews.title: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

reviews.text: The hotel was in a great location.... can’t say enough about that. I had 2 kids with me so the pool was a must. Salt water pool nice just a bit cold and the rubber lining needs to be redone. Additionally the main restaurant was a nice place for a night cap (meet Carl Lewis there) for me while wife and kids were sleeping but not a price friendly for family breakfast or Dinner. Reading terminal has a couple of good spots for breakfast and Margiano's is right across the street. All in All this was a wonderful spot to stay no complaint here and I have stayed at many hotels. Definitely were I was located was a FOUR star hotel. BTW German festival was two blocks away …. LOCATION.. LOCATION
reviews.title: quick trip to see Christmas sights

reviews.text: We took our nine year old son to Philadelphia to view all the Holiday Light displays!! We were greatedly warmly at the fornt desk. My son requested a high floor and we were given the highest floor with the best view of Philadelphia I have ever seen!! What a nice place. e have now stayed at all the downtown Marriott locations, Courtyard, Residence Inn and Now Marriott. We le them all but hands down the service here makes it the best. THANK YOU!!
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, average hotel

reviews.text: I spent 5 nights at this hotel during a recent business trip. The hotel is a short $28 cab ride from the international airport. The hotel is located on Market Street, just down from the City Hall and across the road from a large Maceys store. There are also a large assortment of restaurants and bars close by - with a range of prices and quality. You should be able to find what you want close by. On nearby Walnut Street (go down Broad Street with your back to the town hall, turn right onto Walnut Street) you will also find a collection of designer clothes stores - a great place to shop. This is all within close walking distance from the hotel - so the hotel has a great location.
reviews.title: Poor Marriott

reviews.text: Got a great deal on priceline for about 65 a night. The rooms were very nice and the Elevators were very fast. The lobby was clean, nice and the area around the hotel was safe.
reviews.title: Great Amenties/Location, Bad Service

reviews.text: The hotel is a very central location to walk everywhere from Olde City, to Rittenhouse Square to South Street to the Art Musuem and you can't beat walking 200 feet to the Reading Terminal for Breakfast or Lunch
reviews.title: Conference-focused average Marriott

reviews.text: The place lacks on Service, the Salon had terrible service and the front desk didn't answer the phone a couple time we called
reviews.title: People its a convention hotel

reviews.text: For the price we paid i would defintely stay here again and i can't wait to go back to Philadelphia to experience more of their great restaurants and cool neighborhoods
reviews.title: Great location - HUGE room

likes.liked: — Size of room and the comfy bed

reviews.text: I have stayed in many Marriott properties worldwide, and they can always be relied upon as a 'safe' option - you can (generally!) expect a certain standard of accommodations and service, and while it is always 'samey', at least that standard is pretty high. Marriott hotels are probably the most 'bland' of the major chains - very little is unique to any particular hotel, (even when its something of an historic property, it still seems to have been 'Marriott-ised' to within an inch of its life!)
reviews.title: Great service until a run in with snippy front-desk clerk

likes.liked: — Location, staff except for check-out clerk
likes.disliked: — check-out clerk (check-in clerk was exceptional; too bad she wasn't available upon check out)

reviews.title: Central location
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice and am I big fan. First of all, I love that you can take the subway from the airport to the hotel. I believe it was $7. The hotel is huge, near a bunch of cool stuff and there's a Starbucks (a real one) in the lobby. As I mentioned, you can take the subway either direction from just a few blocks away. Love the gym here, TV's with the treadmills and elipticals. Nice move there. I would recommend this place. Don't rent a car, just take the subway. It's fairly clean and safe, from what I gathered.

reviews.title: giving Marriott a bad reputation
reviews.text: we are silver elite members of Marriott so we stay in Marriotts often-

reviews.title: Nice rooms but fire alarm scare
reviews.text: however this stay was horrible. the renovations in the hotel were more extensive than I was lead to believe-The upstairs bar had terrible service on Saturday night-esp after I saw a waitress sip a cosmo and then proceeded to serve it to a patron!!!!

On day one the towel I was using was stained. The two times I asked for help from the concierge they were less than helpful and treated me as if I was bothering them-the valet was much more helpful. I will never stay at this hotel again
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I attended a conference here with some college students. My students were lucky enough to get upgraded to the deluxe tower, while I was stuck in the regular hotel!
reviews.title: Good Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was robbed in broad daylight in the lobby of this hotel.
reviews.title: Was Robbed At This Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was sitting on a funky double-seating (couch is designed for people to sit on both sides of it and has a cut out in the center of it) in the hotel lobby of this hotel (near the restaurant in the back and to the left of the main entrance) with my purse right next to me. As my friend and I sat there, a woman came up asking for directions to the Gymnastics comeptition that was going on that weekend. As we were giving her directions and pointeing out where she should go, her boyfriend who was sitting on the other side of the couch - with his back backing to us - slipped his hand through the couch cut out (which he had conveniently draped his dry cleaning over to obscure his hand movement from his side of the couch to ours) and removed my wallet from my purse. We didn't realize this of course until an hour later when I went to buy a cup of coffee and my wallet was gone. After calling my credit card companies and finding out thet my cards were being used at that very moment at several shops in the mall next to the hotel, I went personally to those shops and asked for a description of the person or persons who had used my cards. Each store gave me the same description of the woman I spoke with at the hotel and her boyfriend carrying the drycleaning (one shop even offered me the video footage of them using my card).
reviews.title: Location and great service

reviews.text: When I reported this to hotel security, they informed me that the area I was sitting in was not monitored by the security cameras and was located in a spot that was easy for "undesirables" from the street to gain access. They admitted it wasn't very secure and that there was a "ring" of pickpockets that operated in the area and they had likely gained access through a back door. I asked why they didn't monitor this area better, if they knew it wasn't very secure. They didn't have an answer.
reviews.title: Does not live up to the Marriott name

reviews.text: In the aftermath, I received a note from Marriott corporate apologizing for the "incident" and asking that I contact them. I called them and it seems that the only reason they wanted me to call was so they could tell me that they were not liable at all for the theft that occurred on their property. When I recounted what security had shared with me about the area not being monitored and not being secure, the woman I spoke with reiterated that while my experisnce was unfortunate, Marriott bore no liability or responsibility for the incident. In fact, she told me that unless I could prove that Marriott personnel was somehow involved, they were not liable for any thefts or robberies that occur on their properties. I did mention I was surprised that these thiefs managed to find the one area of the bobby that was not secure...
reviews.title: Great Location, Average Room

likes.disliked: — Dated rooms, expensive parking and internet charges.

reviews.text: I was shocked at how defensive the claims people were with me as I was prepared for a more congenial call apologizing and asking if there was anything they could do to make up for my horrible experience in their hotel. Oh, and the best part? I had no money or credit cards - no way to pay for anything (was to stay until Saturday), and they did not even offer to comp so much as a cup of coffee. All they were concerned about was how I was going to pay for my room, which had been prepaid! It was truly an ugly experience and I will never stay at a Marriott again. Customer servie is certainly not a strong suit of theirs and in an industry where customer service matters a lot, I expected better.
reviews.title: Great hotel- beware of friendly ghosts!

description: Adjacent to the Pennsylvania Convention Center and 8 blocks from Independence Hall, this Center City Philadelphia hotel is ideally located near dining, shopping, business, & cultural attractions.
